quote: The diameter of the hair medulla and the margins differ according to the animal species.
In camel, cow and cat, the medulla occupied approximately two thirds of the hair shaft; the margins were smooth in camel and cow, but slightly serrated in cat.
Approximately 50 % of the hair shaft was covered by the medulla in dog, and the margins were smooth.
In dog, the scale margin type and distance were similar to that of sheep, but regular in shape.
